intro: Trifolium nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada clover, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in Nevada and surrounding areas. It is a low-growing perennial herb with trifoliate leaves, each leaflet being oval to lance-shaped and typically hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides. Trifolium nevadense plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
